hints.content:
The denominator in $\dfrac{4}{6}$ is $6$. 

So, there should be $6$ equal parts in each whole.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, and three unlabeled tick marks. Six equal rectangles labeled one-sixth are above the number line between the tick mark at 0 and the tick mark at 1. Each rectangle represents one-sixth of a whole. !

hints.content:
The numerator in $\dfrac{4}{6}$ is $4$. 

So, we need to move $\dfrac16$ on the number line $\blueD4$ times to reach the point.



[[☃ image 1]]

Which number line shows a point located at $\dfrac{4}{6}$?

options.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled four-sixths, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark labeled 1, and three unlabeled tick marks. Six equal rectangles labeled one-sixth are above the number line between the tick mark at 0 and the tick mark at 1. Each rectangle represents one-sixth of a whole. The first four rectangles from the left are shaded. An arrow points to the right along the number line from the tick mark at 0 to the tick mark at four-sixths. !

hints.content:
Number line $\greenD{A}$ shows a point located is at $\dfrac46.$



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, and three unlabeled tick marks. There is a green dot at the fourth tick mark after 0. !

question.content:
**Which point is at $\dfrac{4}{​6}$ on the number line?**
 
[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: $\greenD{A}$ ![A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, and three unlabeled tick marks. There is a green dot at the fourth tick mark after 0. ](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2fe38fd36dbfa6fa2ab9b3557dc4566f38e7e01d)

$\maroonD{B}$ ![A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, and three unlabeled tick marks. There is a pink dot at the third tick mark after 0.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0d53d94851de565da0145c3ccbfc893d89943295)

$\blueD{C}$  ![A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, eleven unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, and six unlabeled tick marks. There is a blue dot at the fourth tick mark after 0.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3d4bf825d18d3152e9b15467bfe2a8a23d6d6af6)
